# Contributing to FIELD

Welcome to FIELD! This guide helps you get started contributing to our digital sovereignty ecosystem.

## Quick Start

### 1. Understanding the Structure

The repository is organized by function:

- **`core/`** - Authentication, security, foundational services
- **`ui/`** - User interfaces and frontend components  
- **`models/`** - AI/ML model management and training
- **`integrations/`** - API connectors and external system adapters
- **`gateway/`** - Communication layer and API routing
- **`analytics/`** - Metrics, insights, and predictive systems
- **`orchestration/`** - System coordination and workflow automation

### 2. Standard Workflow

```bash
# 1. Fork and clone
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/nexus-infinity.git
cd nexus-infinity

# 2. Create feature branch
git checkout -b feature/your-improvement

# 3. Make changes in relevant directory
# Edit files in core/, ui/, models/, etc.

# 4. Test locally
# Each directory has its own testing setup

# 5. Submit pull request
git push origin feature/your-improvement
Development Setup
Prerequisites

NixOS/Nix (for homeostatic configs)
Git (standard version control)
Your language/framework tools (varies by directory)

Getting Help
Ask Questions

GitHub Issues - For bugs and feature requests
GitHub Discussions - For general questions and ideas
Directory READMEs - Each major directory has specific guidance


You don't need to understand the philosophical framework to contribute excellent code. Focus on building software that serves the mission of digital sovereignty and user empowerment.
Questions? Open an issue or check the discussions tab!
